resources.string: We recommend you to use headphones in order to this game.
A game by, Blind Faith Games
This application works on portrait mode.

This is a research project that tries to gather insight on how blind people play games on mobile devices and how developers could make games that are not only accessible, but also enjoyable for them. Select an interaction mode depending on if you have visual discapacity or not. To select make a long press to select an option

This is a research project that tries to gather insight on how blind people play games on mobile devices and how developers could make games that are not only accessible, but also enjoyable for them. Select an interaction mode depending on if you have visual discapacity or not. To select make a long press to select an option

In order to get a better game experience, we recommend you to download the "IVONA Text-to-Speech HQ" synthesizer. Blind Faith Games is not associated or have any relation with IVONA project but we think that is the best synthetizer. Would you like to install it?
Main menu Accessible Minesweeper Game, you can navigate through the menu by making simple taps in the different options and just make a long press to select one of the options below

Golf Game, 2012. 


Golf Game is part of Blind Faith Games (BFG), a research project about how to deliver eyes-free game experiences that are enjoyable on your Android™ device regardless of your sight capabilities. If you have some time to spare, please help us to improve the game by filling in the feedback form that can be reached from the main menu.


BFG is a project of the e-UCM research group, developed by Gloria Pozuelo and Javier √Ålvarez.
 e-UCM is a research group of the Department of Software Engineering and Artificial Intelligence at the Complutense University of Madrid.


More info at: http://blind-faith-games.e-ucm.es
 Contact us at: android@e-ucm.es 


Music: Kevin MacLeod 


Android is a trademark of Google Inc.
Enables sounds that will be played when you find the target dragging on the screen
A range of vibrations helps to find target
Stereo sound helps to find target
A sound will be played before you shoot.
It shows text that contains the TTS speech
It adds one more touch to each screen touch event
Allows to use the application without any visual reference in the game and main menu.

You only have to point and shoot within the shot area! This area is located at the bottom of the screen. Don\'t worry if you don\'t find the shot area, if you do any tap or gesture outside this area you\'ll hear a beep sound.

Within settings you can choose between the next options:
 1 - UpMode enables slingshot mode. In golf, exists two modes of shot. Fling and Slingshot. The first one is enabled by default, allows you shoot, doing a quick scroll on the shot area. Using Slingshot mode you have to do a tap, drag and release your finger to shot.
 2 - Info target allows you to find the hole by simply touching and dragging on the screen. 
 3 - Sound post-shot enables to play a sound whose pitch is decreased during a shot.
 4 - Vibration and Sound feedback - before you shot, a vibration/sound will help you to find where is the hole. To use them during the game you have to describe an arc by dragging your finger on the shot area. You will find the shot area at the bottom on the screen. If you try to do this gestures outside the shot area you will hear a beep sound. The louder vibration/sound you feel/heard, the more accurate will be your shoot. Moreover in sound feedback, if you use headphones, the sound will be played only on one headphone. That indicates that the best position is on the left or on the right from your actual position while you point describing an arc dragging your finger on the shot area.
 you will find more information in the game tutorial.
We recommend you to download the "IVONA Text-to-Speech HQ" synthesizer
Enables to shoot like a Slingshot.

Menu settings. By tapping on each element on this menu changes and reads an option. Particular in this menu you can find two profile options\: A and B whose activation enables another options on the menu. Of course, you can continue enabling independently all option on the menu. You will find the next options on this menu\:

Key Configuration. By tapping on your left you could listen the action descriptions and by tapping on your right you will change the key related by an action. If you are in blind interaction mode you have to do a long click to be able to change the configuration. You have the next options\:
To repeat the last sinthetizer voice message
Press ok to back to the main menu
You are outside of the shot area. To be able to shot you have to make a scroll gesture on the bottom of the screen.
Previous games ranking. You can listen this ranking clicking on each cell.
You have changed the key associated with

In this tutorial you\'ll learn the game basics. The game goal is achieve the highest score. This must be successful launch pit. You can launch the ball at the launch area located at the bottom of the screen. When you will leave this area, you will hear a beep notification sound. We have two modes of play, free mode, where you can make as many shots as you want and 18 holes mode, which will count the score on 18 holes. To find your score, you has a marker on the left edge of the screen to the height of the throwing area. If you make a click on it, it will notify you the cumulative score achieved.

All this features can be enabled/disabled in the settings menu. Tutorial begins! To shoot you have to do a fling on the shoot area. i.e. you have to do a quick scroll gesture in the direction that you want to shoot
By default that is the shot mode. Each time you score a shot, the target will change its position.
You can change the shot mode in settings. To shoot, drag as if it were a slingshot and release the screen touch.
The clue target option, let you localize the target by touches and drags. Let\'s try it.
This sound is emitted when you find the target.

The next two options give you information about which direction is best. The vibration gives you a clue about where is located the target. You have to describe an arc, by dragging your finger on the shot area to feel this feature. The position in the arc that you describe that sound louder will indicate you a which is the best direction to shot. Once you have find a good position in the arc, do the gesture appropiated down.

The sound effect also is an aid to locate the target at the shot. You have to describe an arc, dragging in the shot area to listen to this feature. The position in the arc that you describe that sound louder indicates a better direction to do a shot. Once you have find a good position in the arc, do the gesture appropiated down.
The sound when you don\'t score a shot indicates how far your shot has gone out of the target. Sound deeper indicates that your shot has been worse. If you scores you \'ll hear a applause.
Your punctuaction have been incremented to
Your punctuaction have been decremented to
Your number of consecutive shots is zero.

You can navigate through this form menu by making long taps on the buttons next and previous situated below of each option set or text. If you click on a text or a button and its text will be read and, important!! if it\'s a answer button will be selected.
In this case, if you want, you can write in a field your opinion about the application.
From now on, making taps, you can choose between different answers to respond questions.
You can fill this field with your opinion.

This is a research project that tries to gather insight on how blind people play games on mobile devices and how developers could make games that are not only accessible, but also enjoyable for them. To achieve these goals, we would like to know some details about you and how you interact with technologies in general and games in particular. This will help us to interpret your answers to this questionnaire. All the information collected through this questionnaire will be anonymous, untraceable and will be treated confidentially and only used for the purpose of the study. \n
Mark the option that better describes your current visual level
Rate how often you play games in your computer or game console. Where 1 means "Never" and 5 "very often"
Rate how often you play games in your mobile device (phone or tablet). Where 1 means "Never" and 5 "very often"
Please rate how easy/difficult it was to learn to play. Where 1 means "very difficult" and 5 "very easy".
Rate how fun it was to play. Where 1 means "very boring" and 5 "very fun".
Rate how engaging was the game. Where 1 means "not engaging" and 5 "very engaging".
Rate how pleasant or frustrating was the interaction with the game. Where 1 means "very frustrating" and 5 "very pleasant".
Rate how you liked the story and narrative atmosphere (if applicable). Where 1 means "I didn\'t like it at all" and 5 "I liked it very much".
Rate how you liked the accessibility and control settings. Where 1 means "I didn\'t like it at all" and 5 "I liked it very much".
Rate how you liked the feedback provide by the game. Where 1 means "I didn\'t like it at all" and 5 "I liked it very much".
Finally, please provide any comments or suggestions to improve the game. Then tap on "Finish" to send the responses to us, and that\'s all!
Your screen has turned on. May be you have to unlock your device.
